definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Recent history has witnessed the exciting politicization of meat.
sentences.chinese: 近代歷史見證了肉食品的政治化。

sentences.english: Sun Weide, spokesman for the Beijing Olympic Organizing Committee, has urged that the Games not be politicized.
sentences.chinese: 北京奧組委發言人孫維德呼籲不要將奧運會政治化。

sentences.english: Another brother, Uday, said the verdict was politically motivated.
sentences.chinese: 他的另一個弟弟Uday說，“判罰被政治化了。”

sentences.english: China has reacted angrily to what it calls attempts to "politicise" the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 中國對企圖把奧運會“政治化”的行爲十分不滿。

sentences.english: She says her mother found the war a liberating and politicising experience.
sentences.chinese: 她說她的母親認爲二戰的經歷解放並政治化了她。

sentences.english: Yet the re-entry to the politicized world of science in China can be challenging.
sentences.chinese: 不過重入政治化了的中國科學界可能是一個挑戰。

sentences.english: Hiring and firing became heavily politicized.
sentences.chinese: 僱傭和解僱工人變得嚴重政治化。

sentences.english: These investment activities should not be politicized,' she said.
sentences.chinese: 這些投資活動不應該被政治化。

sentences.english: Rogge asked people not to politicize the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 反要人們不要把奧運政治化。

sentences.english: However, the committee felt that the meeting should not be politicized.
sentences.chinese: 但是，委員會覺得會議不應該被政治化。

sentences.english: politically and scientifically but she didn't know when to stop.
sentences.chinese: 更政治化和科學化，而她不知道如何停止它。

sentences.english: The modern politicized Christians also privatize religion.
sentences.chinese: 現代的政治化基督徒把宗教也私人化了。

sentences.english: The principle of the Olympics must be upheld, that is, the Olympic Games should not be politicized.
sentences.chinese: 我們要秉承奧運會的宗旨，就是不能把奧運會政治化。

sentences.english: Fifth, don't politicize economic and trade issues.
Opposition groups say the reform will politicise judges.
sentences.chinese: 反對派團體說，這次改革將使法官政治化。
資格證書已經完全政治化了。

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: to come to the surface/to become apparent
